title: Anxiolytic
summary: An anxiolytic (/ˌæŋksiəˈlɪtɪk, ˌæŋksioʊ-/; also antipanic or antianxiety agent)[1] is a medication or other intervention that reduces anxiety. This effect is in contrast to anxiogenic agents which increase anxiety.  Anxiolytic medications are used for the treatment of anxiety disorder and its related psychological and physical symptoms.
